captions.text: - What the fuck are we doing today?

- It's like a metal-y,
bottle-y kind of taste to it.
- Since it just makes me thirstier,
Yes, because it is the life source

It's made by the biggest
soda company in the world.
There's something evil about that, right?

- The way it splashes
really reminds me of water.
- This just, it tastes like water,
which is what I want from my water.

now that I'm talking all
this good stuff about it.
- This is what I'm talking about,
this is just the normal stuff.
- I don't have any problems with it.

- This is like your
older brother's holding
your head underwater in a pool,

and you take just one little
gasp of air, desperately,
but all you get is chlorine.
- Oh, I don't like this one.

- Guys, my water palate
is pretty on point, right?
- So I know it's not cheap
End of the taste, a little tap water-y.
- I don't know, something about it
tastes like it's seen some pipes.

but you'd have more fun
spraying it on your lawn.
- I would say like 1.50 a bottle?

- That's upsetting,
because it looks so pretty.
I just know from the smell,
I don't even need to taste this thing.

- Because everyone knows
L.A. water is disgusting.

- If somebody sells this,
they should be ashamed.
- I now want to go back and revise
all my other answers, because I was like,
- No, you should not pay more for water.

If you're paying for this
designer brand bottle,
just know what you're paying for
is that fancy, cool looking design.

No one has any right to
be snobbish about water,

it's one of the most
essential things in the world,
we are lucky to have it,

comments.text:
in america people purchase reverse osmosis filters for their homes tap 
water, i strongly recommend looking into it if you have a house in a place 
where tap water is known to be bad, my house in Palm Springs needs it while 
my place in Oregon doesnt need as much filtering (though Oregon tap water 
is generally filtered river water and doesnt contain fluoride)﻿

comments.text:
+Sean Sidi Your NYC water has been through several basements and a few 
sewers on it's way to you, there was a news story a few years back that the 
largest water leak in the world is in a river-sized water duct that brings 
water in to the city, it leaks something like a million gallons a minute 
through a bunch of towns in long island on it's way to the city.  That was 
something I read anyway.

don't feel bad for spending the same on a bottle of water.﻿
